page.title: 07CROFT MAID
page.content: The Brown family has farmed Croft Maid for at least forty years and is twenty acres in size. At present one part time pensioner called Jock Bell is employed. On the Croft they have one cat,two bantam cockrels,fifteen banty hens and twenty head of cattle for fattening. They also have one tractor, plough, harrow, roller and muck spreader. They also borrow machinery at hay making time from nearby farms. They grow grass for hay,and kale and turnips for winter feeding of cows. Mrs. Brown does daily jobs such as calving, mucking out byres, etc. The farm has 6 outbuildings- 2 byres, 3 hay sheds and a pig sty ( used as a store).The house got its name from a nearby road called Croche. The land includes a disused railway last used in 1962 by goods trains.
